abstract: Strong earnings reports excited Wall Street on Wednesday, pushing the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index above the 1,200-point threshold for the first time since the beginning of the financial crisis, The New York Times reported.
snippet: Strong earnings reports excited Wall Street on Wednesday, pushing the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index above the 1,200-point threshold for the first time since the beginning of the financial crisis, The New York Times reported.
lead_paragraph: Strong earnings reports excited Wall Street on Wednesday, pushing the Standard & Poor’s 500-stock index above the 1,200-point threshold for the first time since the beginning of the financial crisis, The New York Times’s Javier C. Hernandez reported.

headline.main: Standard & Poor at Highest Level Since 2008
